clinical_study.brief_title: Hypocaloric Enteral Nutrition in the Critically Ill Patient
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of Hypocaloric Hyperproteic Enteral Nutrition in the Critically Ill Patient

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare two nutritional regimes in critically ill patients. Patients will be randomized to standard care (25 kcal per kg) or to hypocaloric nutrition (15 kcal per kg). Both regimes will recive 1,7 g/Kg/dia The main outcome will be the SOFA (sequential organ failure assessment) score. The hypothesis is that hypocaloric hyperproteic diet decreases the incidence of organic failure in these patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The research site will be the intensive care unit (ICU) of Hospital Universitario San Ignacio; eligible patients will >18 years of age with a presumed fasting period of at least 96 hours, with no contraindications for enteral nutrition. Patients with parenteral nutrition, pregnancy, diabetes, liver failure, renal failure, transplant protocol, or admitted from another hospital will be excluded. In all patients, the following information will be collected daily: enteral formula in ml, carbohydrate intake, insulin required (in IU), presence of hyper or hypoglicemia, presence of infections, among others.
The SOFA score will be assessed every two days until discharge from ICU.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the intial SOFA (Sequential Organ Failure Assessment) score at 48 hours.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours after the onset of nutrition
primary_outcome.description: SOFA score evaluates six systems: respiratory, cardiovascular, coagulation, Central Nervous System, liver and renal. Each system gets a score from 0 (normal) to 4 (abnormal) and the sum of each score defines the final SOFA score, which 24 is the maximum score (high risk of morality) and 0 is the minimum score (low risk of mortality).

secondary_outcome.measure: Units of insulin require in a day
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 4 days after the onset of nutrition
secondary_outcome.description: This is an indirect measure of glycemic control, and is reported as a daily average of the units of insuline require in the first 4 days since nutritional regimen starts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days the patient requires mechanical ventilation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 28 days after the onset of nutrition

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of days in the intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within the first 28 days after the onset of nutrition
28 days after the onset of nutrition
secondary_outcome.description: We will interview each patient 28 days after the start of the study to assess the global mortality

arm_group.description: 15 kcal per kg of body weight and 1.7 grams of protein per kg.
25 kcal per kg of body weight and 1.7 grams of protein per kg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years
- Estimated fasting period of at least 96 hours
- ICU patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parenteral nutrition
- Pregnancy
- Diabetes
- Liver failure
- Transplantation or in transplant protocol
- Previous nutrition support
- Chronic Renal failure
